intro: Anemarrhena cavaleriei, commonly known as the Chinese sandwort, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
